item.title: Fears raised as Superbug spread far and fast...

item.title: PAPER: 20,000 fans at Harris hometown launch!
item.description:
www.sfchronicle.com
Sen. Kamala Harris, D-Calif., often invokes her East Bay upbringing as the child of civil-rights activists to explain her political philosophy. At a rally Sunday in her hometown of Oakland, she officially launched her presidential campaign by tapping those same populist themes. Before an estimated 20,000 people who filled the streets around an American flag-draped Frank Ogawa Plaza, Harris made her opening 2020 pitch: She will be the candidate who is both “a fighter for the people” and someone who can unite a country severed into partisan corners by saying that “we must seek truth, speak truth and fight for the truth.” “People in power are trying to convince us that the villain in our American story is each other.
